comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: His obituary in the NYT of August 16, 1975, was less sensational! select.nytimes.com/mem/archive/pdf?res=FA0F11FB3558157493... [needs subscription] It notes that Urrutia was, as a young man, personal physician to Mexican President Porfirio Diaz and was named Interior Minister in 1913. He fled a year later and after being captured by American soldiers was released in Galveston and spent the rest of his long life in the United States as a doctor, and medical educator.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The same photo used in a prominent article in the New-York tribune., May 19, 1914, Page 1

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for your research on this man. Given his long life, and time spent in the US, it seems likely that it is the same person, hockadilly.
